=====Fred strikes back=====
*<s>We should probably be referring to it as "Trask Chowder" due to the cookbook, no? And it uses "this chowder," indicating that it's simply one kind of chowder, which means the term "chowder" doesn't refer only to this dish.</s> [[User:Master Fredcerique|<span style="color: #45CF10">'''MasterFred'''</span>]][[File:Commerce Guild.svg|20px]][[User talk:Master Fredcerique|<span style="color: #0674F3">('''talk''')</span>]] (he/him) 21:55, 5 May 2022 (UTC)
**I'm really torn on this. I get that the cookbook uses Trask in the title to make it seem Star Wars-y, but it's clearly the exact same chowder as we see in the episode, so to have a page for Trask Chowder and regular chowder seems a little redundant - they'd cover the exact same thing and would be pretty similar. Naturally chowder doesn't only refer to this dish, but I'm not sure the best way to do this. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family:copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 17:52, 9 May 2022 (UTC)
***I'd personally go with Trask Chowder as well since it's a distinct name for this specific dish rather than the general food type. [[User:Ayrehead02|Ayrehead02]] ([[User talk:Ayrehead02|talk]]) 09:54, 10 May 2022 (UTC)
***Alrighty then. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family:copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 17:42, 16 May 2022 (UTC)

*Reviewing notes: our practice is to put species before gender, and we don't really use TV episode citation templates in reference notes. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family:copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 05:20, 10 March 2022 (UTC)

***We're not super consistent about it--you'll often see it for magazine articles and comics, though I've been discouraging the use of it for TV. =====Shayanomer=====
*<s>Does this individual Maz speaks to have a page?</s> [[User:Shayanomer|<span style="color:#DEB40D">'''Shayanomer'''</span>]] [[File:Din Djarin's clan.svg|15px]] ([[User talk:Shayanomer|<span style="color:#A06800">'''talk'''</span>]]) 04:52, 26 March 2022 (UTC)
**The individual is the viewer. The camera pans into Maz in Volume 1 and she looks at the camera and greets the "visitor" and tells them stories. She does stuff around her campfire and just talks to the camera. Maz refers to the viewer as friend but that's about it. We know nothing about the individual. Volume 3 opens with the viewer coming upon Maz searching through her stuff and she greets them and informs them what she's doing. Then more stories. I'm of the opinion the character shouldn't have an article. [[User:NBDani|NBDani]] ([[User talk:NBDani|talk]]) 11:37, 26 March 2022 (UTC)

=====Spooky=====
*<s>Though open to hear about the context of it if there is any, the quote presented in personality and traits seems not relevant to the article. It doesn't really have anything unique about the trooper's personality&mdash;seems a non-notable exclamation that doesn't need to be included.</s>
**Removed. -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 20:25, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
*<s>If the missing comlink is to be mentioned, it'd make sense to mention the rest of what he stole too in that incident - (referring to novel) "Unfortunately, his blaster, power packs, and concussion grenades had."</s>
**Thrawn used the comlink, but not the others if my memory serves me right. How would you incorporate mention of them? -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 19:14, 20 April 2022 (UTC)
***Seems like the novel's chapter one details that Thrawn was knocking out perimeter troopers with the concussion grenades and causing other terror to the officers with the power packs, and as a result this trooper (and his squad) were sent to go subdue the Chiss when Barris' men failed. Though on rereading the chapter, it also seems like this specific trooper is said to be holding a blaster rifle as part of the ones sent out (which does match the comic's depiction) and could thus be in equipment.'''—[[User:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">spookywilloww</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">talk</span>]]</sup>''' 19:44, 20 April 2022 (UTC)
****I took [https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/Unidentified_clone_trooper_(Thrawn)?type=revision&diff=11405513&oldid=11400657 a stab] at it. Good enough? -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 00:50, 24 April 2022 (UTC)
*<s>I might be completely missing in my read-overs but&mdash;where exactly in ''Thrawn'' or the comic specify that the this trooper was a clone? Or that he was wearing [[clone trooper armor]] (largely, not used by 16 BBY anyways especially given it's linking to Generation One armor there) instead of [[stormtrooper armor]]? I've seen them consistently called a stormtrooper, but not much else.</s>'''—[[User:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">spookywilloww</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">talk</span>]]</sup>''' 07:20, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
**I infer that he's a clone stormtrooper because of his clone trooper armor, yes. I believe {{U|Editoronthewiki}} was the first to do so. -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 20:25, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
***My main query was to question&mdash;what defines the depicted armor as ''not'' just stormtrooper armor and ''definitely'' clone trooper armor? From what I can see it visually looks exactly like stormtrooper armor (which given, is based on Phase II); and the novel text also calls the individuals searching only by stormtroopers, referring to the CW era stuff as mostly bygone relic. In canon, most of the clones had been phased out by this year given it's so late into the Imperial Era - I'm not doubting that there may be some cases of Imperial stormtroopers assumed to be clones especially in the initial period before the armor types were transferred and the clones were shifted out, but I'd like to hear more about the proof behind this trooper being a clone, specifically.'''—[[User:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">spookywilloww</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">talk</span>]]</sup>''' 20:37, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
****All of the troopers on Thrawn's exile planet have helmets that are distinctly Phase II clone trooper armor and not stormtrooper armor. See e.g. [[:File:CaptiveThrawn.png]] or [[:File:Unidentified-planet-Thrawns-exile.png]] for examples. -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 20:54, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
****The black spots over the eyes are separate in stormtrooper armor, but in P2CT helmets, they connect and go down. -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 20:55, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
*****In that case&mdash;only referencing to ''Thrawn'' 1 for that wouldn't be enough since; neither of the article's sources defines what Phase II armor is in prose or it's characteristics to then make the assumption off that trait that this character must be a clone. The reference note in turn would then need to source an entry/data of some kind (probably from USW or something) that details the characteristics of standard clone trooper armor, and state that it's the armor depicted in the comic, which would then make the character a clone, and not a normal trooper.'''—[[User:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">spookywilloww</span>]]<sup>[[User talk:Spookywilloww|<span style="color:#aa76de; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">talk</span>]]</sup>''' 21:02, 8 April 2022 (UTC)
******I gave it a stab. Is this adequate? -- [[User:YakovChaimTzvi|YakovChaimTzvi]] <small>(he/him/his)</small> [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px|linkWP:Chiss]] ([[User_talk:YakovChaimTzvi|talk]]) 19:14, 20 April 2022 (UTC)

====Object====
=====Erebus=====
*<s>The first paragraph currently has no mention of the moon.</s>
*<s>In the first paragraph, for the date note, you can use <nowiki>{{TCWcanondates|712}}</nowiki> to simplify the dating requirements.</s>
*<s>The link for the [[Nu-class attack/transport shuttle]] currently directs to the Legends page.</s> [[User:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">Erebus Chronus</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">(Talk)</span></b>]]</sup> 06:08, 21 February 2022 (UTC)
**Second and third objections handled.
**The first paragraph is written to provide context for what's going on aboard the ''Tribunal'' which ultimately leads it to crash. I'm not sure working a mention of the moon in is quite doable at this point, although I will be giving that some more thought. [[User:SilverSunbird|SilverSunbird]] ([[User talk:SilverSunbird|talk]]) 06:14, 21 February 2022 (UTC)
***All done. [[User:SilverSunbird|SilverSunbird]] ([[User talk:SilverSunbird|talk]]) 00:01, 22 February 2022 (UTC)
*<s>"Mostly" is a bit of subjective writing, since it's also brown and green in color from space.</s>
*<s>Your wording on the moon doesn't align between the intro and the Description.</s>
*<s>Context for the Clone Wars.</s>
*<s>After looking over History, the section could probably be trimmed down a bit, since I'm seeing a lot of information irrelevant to the moon itself.</s>

***The Clone Wars being three years can't be sourced straight to Episode III.

====Object====
=====Unidentified Kilji councilor=====
*<s>Shouldn't the first image be on the article's left and the last one on the article's right?</s>
**Not necessarily, no. The important thing is just that they alternate sides.
*<s>Using "the Sith councilor" repeatedly is repetitive. Could you use something like "the Sith" or the "Sith male" at some point to remove some repetivenes? {{C|And identify him as a male, of course}}</s> &mdash; '''''[[User:Samonic|Samonic]]''''' [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px]]  18:16, 6 May 2022 (UTC)
**Unfortunately, I do not believe that doing so would actually improve the article at all. Except for the Daragon twins, ''all'' of the characters mentioned in the article are Sith males. Note that I have actually already taken effort to vary the usage a bit where possible, referring to him as "(Sith) Councilor", "(Sith) Lord" and by the male pronoun "he". But at the end of the day, it's just one guy among many guys who all have the same attributes, and it's only their name (if applicable), appearance and actions that differentiate them. (And BTW, it's not mandatory to always explicitly say "male" if masculine pronouns do the trick.) [[User:Imperators II|<b><span>Imperators II</span></b>]]<sup>[[User talk:Imperators II|(Talk)]]</sup> 19:21, 6 May 2022 (UTC)

====Object====
=====CC-8=====
*<s>I'd like it to be clear as to how Dex was deceiving the crew</s> [[User:Commander Code-8|<b><span style="color: Purple">Commander Code-8</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Commander Code-8|<span style="color: Maroon">Hello There!</span>]]</sup> 01:10, 20 August 2022 (UTC)
**I don't see what other details are needed - the recording says it's on Shara'Tam and provides coordinates, which Dex claims places Shara'Tam in the Ishram system. This is a lie, but Jarl only has this Togruta check info about the Ishram system and doesn't check the coordinates himself, so when the datapad confirms that the Ishram system was destroyed, he assumes that Shara'Tam is also destroyed. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family: 'Copperplate Gothic', copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 15:41, 22 August 2022 (UTC)
***What I think needs to be made clear in the article is that Shara'Tam wasn't in the Ishram system [[User:Commander Code-8|<b><span style="color: Purple">Commander Code-8</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Commander Code-8|<span style="color: Maroon">Hello There!</span>]]</sup> 09:38, 2 September 2022 (UTC)
****Added. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family: 'Copperplate Gothic', copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 14:16, 2 September 2022 (UTC)

=====Vergence=====
*<s>Being ashen-faced at one point isn't a personality trait, it's just an emotion. I think it should be moved to the history section.</s>
**An emotion is often a display of personality, and there's not much else to put in that section anyway.
***Sometimes it is, but being upset when something you cared about is lost isn't one of those times. I think you can just remeove the section.
****Fine, done. [[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family: 'Copperplate Gothic', copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 16:50, 11 September 2022 (UTC)

As such, the unidentified clone veteran's appearance must have also taken place '''in''' 9 BBY." while the '''Body''' "'''Around''' 9 BBY,[4] the clone begged Jedi Master in hiding Obi-Wan Kenobi—" Both should say '''in 9 BBY'''.</s> '''[[User:Samonic|<font style="color:#bd730b;">'''Samonic'''</font>]]''' [[File:ChissAscendancyCanonSymbol.svg|20px]] 16:01, 17 July 2022 (UTC)

(also, by the way, you can source to a bad batch episode to get the name War-Mantle, and through that you can cite it was also included recruits. basically the corps were created by ''both'' conscripts and volunteers even thought the databank only lists conscripts. feel free to dm for more explanation if this doesn't make sense)</s>  [[User:Editoronthewiki|Editoronthewiki]] ([[User talk:Editoronthewiki|talk]]) 22:44, 8 September 2022 (UTC)

*<s>[https://www.starwars.com/obi-wan-kenobi-part-ii-trivia-gallery ''Obi-Wan Kenobi'' Part II Trivia Gallery] on StarWars.com says the clone is "20 or so" years old chronologically.</s>

[[User:JediMasterMacaroni|<font style="font-family:copperplate; color:#ff4d00;">'''JediMasterMacaroni'''</font>]][[User talk:JediMasterMacaroni|<sup><font style="color:#ff4d00;">(Talk)</font></sup>]] 22:21, 25 March 2022 (UTC)

====Object====
=====Imp=====
*<s>"''Located within the tangle of sharp, towering mountains, and plunging gorges and tall columns of the moon''" &mdash; this is rich Description info. Can you try and move at least some of it there?</s>
**Moved a bit to Description. Let me know if that's too much.
*<s>While you're at it, you should fix the dangling participle issue in that sentence: "''Located within the tangle of sharp, towering mountains, and plunging gorges and tall columns of the moon, Vassek 3 served as the location of the personal fortress of Kaleesh Separatist General Grievous.''" the ''fortress'', not ''Vassek 3'', was located within the tangle.</s>
**How's that?
*<s>Can we have consistency between referencing in infobox and the body?</s>
**Is that fine, or should I just cite it being in the Vassek system to the BMF issue?
***If the BMF issue gives the name for the system, that would allow you reduce the number of references used in that paragraph, yeah.
****Changed.
*<s>It's been a while since I last saw the episode, is the "his" here supposed to refer to Fisto or Vebb? "''his detachment of clone troopers''"</s>
**Yeah, I was referring to Vebb.
***Was Vebb actually a Jedi General? Before my copy-edit, you used to differentiate between Fisto and Vebb by referring to the latter as a Jedi Knight. I know there's next to no policy governing article subsection titles, but they probably shouldn't be misleading, so in case if Vebb isn't a General, "Encounter with Jedi Generals" should probably be something else. [[User:Imperators II|<b><span>Imperators II</span></b>]]<sup>[[User talk:Imperators II|(Talk)]]</sup> 13:05, 31 January 2022 (UTC)
****There. [[User:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">Erebus Chronus</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">(Talk)</span></b>]]</sup> 17:56, 31 January 2022 (UTC)
*<s>Since it's so prominently visible in the image, do you think it's worth noting the vehicle Fisto arrived on Vassek 3 on? What about Vebb and the troopers, do we know about their vehicle of arrival?</s>
**Added both. I'll also try and get an image for the second subsection.
*<s>I'd like you try and rewrite the third paragraph of History so that it's presented from a more omniscient perspective (the reader should know upfront that it was Grievous's fortress that Fisto and Vebb entered).</s>
**Is that good? Added another paragraph because it felt like I was restricting the information.
*<s>A dictionary gives the meaning of the word "to coerce" as "To pressure, intimidate, or force (someone) into doing something." Are you sure this applies to Dooku's actions? I was under the impression that the Jedi were ''tricked'' into traveling to Vassek 3, which doesn't really fall under the definition of someone being "forced", I believe.</s> [[User:Imperators II|<b><span>Imperators II</span></b>]]<sup>[[User talk:Imperators II|(Talk)]]</sup> 16:45, 20 January 2022 (UTC)
**Yeah, I used that word wrong. [[User:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">Erebus Chronus</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">(Talk)</span></b>]]</sup> 21:48, 21 January 2022 (UTC)

=====x=====
*<s>Similar to my objection on [[Vassek system]], there are definitely quotes to be found for both the Description and Locations sections.</s> [[User:Xd1358|<span style="color:#336600;font-weight:bold;">1358</span>]] [[User_talk:Xd1358|<sup style="color:#336600;">(Talk)</sup>]] 10:53, 4 March 2022 (UTC)
**How are those? [[User:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">Erebus Chronus</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">(Talk)</span></b>]]</sup> 16:25, 6 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>"''Locating the tracking beacon from a Republic vessel utilized in Gunray's supposed escape to Vassek's third moon, Fisto landed on the moon's surface in his personal starfighter, where he reunited with his former Padawan, Jedi Knight Nahdar Vebb, and the latter's detachment of clone troopers led by Clone Commander Fil, who had arrived on the natural satellite in a Republic shuttle.[3]''" Run-on sentence, needs splitting.
*"''A depressing and gloomy structure filled with deadly traps, the looming fortress[1] was also home to Gor, the general's roggwart pet, and was maintained by at least five B1-series battle droids and Grievous's EV-series medical droid, EV-A4-D, who was responsible for carrying out any repairs on Grievous's damaged cybernetics, and protected by several IG-100 MagnaGuard droids.[3]''</s> Same with this one. [[User:Xd1358|<span style="color:#336600;font-weight:bold;">1358</span>]] [[User_talk:Xd1358|<sup style="color:#336600;">(Talk)</sup>]] 15:59, 14 March 2022 (UTC)
**How are those? [[User:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">Erebus Chronus</span></b>]] <sup>[[User talk:Erebus Chronus|<b><span style="color:#3e236e">(Talk)</span></b>]]</sup> 16:16, 14 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>Lastly, the intro is a bit sparse when compared to the article size. You could probably elaborate slightly on why the engagemang took place (they were tracking Gunray), and then another sentence on the outcome of the engagement.</s> [[User:Xd1358|<span style="color:#336600;font-weight:bold;">1358</span>]] [[User_talk:Xd1358|<sup style="color:#336600;">(Talk)</sup>]] 17:34, 14 March 2022 (UTC)

====Support====

====Comments====
*Note that the reused Death Star background doesn't automatically mean that WED15-I7's necessarily on the Death Star IU, as cases such as ''[[The Star Wars Holiday Special]]'' reusing Death Star footage are proof it's not a duck test scenario. Also notably another angle for the same model is shown among a lineup of droids on the Death Star in the ''[[Death Star Owner's Technical Manual]]'' book, but there's no evidence it's the same droid. [[User:Hanzo Hasashi|Hanzo Hasashi]] ([[User talk:Hanzo Hasashi|talk]]) 02:08, 3 March 2022 (UTC)
*[https://starwars.fandom.com/wiki/WSB-15_sabotage_droid?type=revision&diff=11330543&oldid=11311625 My copy-edit]. =====YEEEET=====
*<s>"''Kara Xoo was the Tempest Runner of Kara Xoo's Tempest.''" Besides the fact its stating the obvious, it's not got any mention of Yeet. I would be better to just say "Yeet's tempest" or something like that. Also it's the only mention of the title Tempest Runner in the whole article.</s>
**done [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 22:39, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>Context required for Avon Starros and children, Poisoned Barb, Dalna in the intro and Hynestia in the bio.</s>
**done [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 22:36, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
***And Dalna? [[User:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Braha'tok enthusiast</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Hello there</span>]]</sup> 01:21, 25 March 2022 (UTC)
****right, done [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 02:33, 25 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>Got a source for that date?</s>
**i do now :p [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 22:25, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>"first appeared" is only used if there's multiple appearances (aside from the audiobooks), so "first" is not needed here.</s>
**donzo [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 22:17, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>"''Sometime during 230 BBY, after arriving on the planet Dalna, the temporary stronghold of Kara Xoo's Tempest, Squib, a strike in the Tempest, entered the cargo hold of the Poisoned Barb, the flagship of Kara Xoo, the leader of the tempest, and pointed a blaster at the children inside, who had been kidnapped from their respective planets, ordering them to follow Yeet off the ship.''" Riiiight lets dissect this one. There's context for everything, that's good. Buuut, you've made so many clauses for it that it's just convoluted. So what I'm thinking is you move Kara Xoo's introduction up to that of the tempest and introduce them both together like "the tempest led by the Quarren Kara Xoo". With the children, you introduce them as "the" children as if we already know about. I'd say introduce them as something like "a group of kidnapped children" or "a group of children who had been&hellip;". And finally, you could just say "the strike Squib" to get rid of the extra clause. You contextualise stuff with clauses quite a lot so I, personally, would recommend trying to avoid (if there's a way to, of course) that just to keep the sentences less convoluted with parts.</s> [[User:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Braha'tok enthusiast</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Hello there</span>]]</sup> 19:36, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
** aaaaand done. thanks for the tips [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 22:50, 24 March 2022 (UTC)
*<s>So Yeet's birth is dated to by the one time they appear. Does the book actually mention their birth? Otherwise the birthdate field shouldn't be filled.</s> [[User:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Braha'tok enthusiast</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Hello there</span>]]</sup> 01:21, 25 March 2022 (UTC)
** it does not, removed [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 02:35, 25 March 2022 (UTC)

If so, they can go in the article.</s> [[User:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Braha'tok enthusiast</span>]] <sup>[[User talk:Braha'tok enthusiast|<span style="color:#0047ab; font-family:Trebuchet MS;">Hello there</span>]]</sup> 01:24, 25 March 2022 (UTC)

"''According to Nihil Scientist Doctor Zadina Mkampa, Yeet had a tragic history of losing recruits. Sometime in 230 BBY,''"</s>

**okay this is tricky. a strike is a person (the lowest rank in tje nihil) and also a group (the lowest ranking unit in the Nihil). there really isnt an easy way to diffrenciate in context, so i removed one mention of the strike (individual), if that works [[User:SkywalkerZIARA|skywalkerZIARA]] ([[User talk:SkywalkerZIARA|talk]]) 05:40, 28 May 2022 (UTC)
